explanation: in a way that shows strong feelings
sentence: Too often we ardently pursue the wrong things.
sentence_gap: Too often we ________ pursue the wrong things.

sentence: But shops and artists who purchase bootleg flash art are cheating themselves, too.
sentence_gap: But shops and artists who purchase _______ flash art are cheating themselves, too.

explanation: to join with something, or to join things together
sentence: The units can be conjoined to form grids.
sentence_gap: The units can be _________ to form grids.

explanation: to do something in a way that shows you think you are too important to do it
sentence: She just grunted, not deigning to look up from the page.
sentence_gap: She just grunted, not ________ to look up from the page.

explanation: (of a wound or cut) to become badly infected; (of bad feelings or thoughts) to become much worse because you do not deal with them successfully
sentence: Instead of talking the matter over with him, she allowed her resentment to fester in her mind.
sentence_gap: Instead of talking the matter over with him, she allowed her resentment to ______ in her mind.

explanation: weakness and lack of health or strength
sentence: Though ill for most of her life, physical frailty never stopped her from working.
sentence_gap: Though ill for most of her life, physical _______ never stopped her from working.

sentence: If you are a boy, go and get your hatchet, and set off for the mountains to chop wood!
sentence_gap: If you are a boy, go and get your _______, and set off for the mountains to chop wood!

explanation: confusion and lack of order, especially causing damage or trouble
sentence: These insects can wreak havoc on crops.
sentence_gap: These insects can wreak _____ on crops.

explanation: informal; a small amount of food eaten between meals or as a meal
sentence: I have a little nosh at about 10.30, so I don't overeat at lunch.
sentence_gap: I have a little ____ at about 10.30, so I don't overeat at lunch.

explanation: a garden tool with a long handle and long, pointed metal parts sticking out in a row at the bottom, used for making the earth level or for collecting leaves, etc.
sentence: Fetch the rake from the shed.

explanation: to cook something liquid, or something with liquid in it, at a temperature slightly below boiling
sentence: Leave the vegetables to simmer for a few minutes.
sentence_gap: Leave the vegetables to ______ for a few minutes.

explanation: easily upset or shocked by things that you find unpleasant or that you do not approve of
sentence: She's really squeamish and can't stand the sight of blood.
sentence_gap: She's really _________ and can't stand the sight of blood.

explanation: to bend the top half of the body forward and down
sentence: The doorway was so low that we had to stoop to go through it.
sentence_gap: The doorway was so low that we had to _____ to go through it.

sentence: The success of the event will be determined by the vagaries of the weather.
sentence_gap: The success of the event will be determined by the ________ of the weather.

explanation: an outside area in which plants are left to grow naturally or untidily
sentence: The garden was a wilderness of weeds and overgrown bushes.
sentence_gap: The garden was a __________ of weeds and overgrown bushes.
